SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.data

Class Histogram<T>

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.data.Histogram<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of items to be stored in the histogram
public final class Histogram<T> extends Object
A generic class that represents a histogram, which counts occurrences of various items. It supports functionality to add items, retrieve counts, and determine the most frequently occurring item.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static final record 
    Histogram.Entry<T>
    A record that represents an immutable key-value pair consisting of a key and its associated count.

  • Method Details

    • createIdentityBased

      public static <T> Histogram<T> createIdentityBased()
      Creates a new instance of a Histogram that backed by an IdentityHashMap to count occurrences. This ensures that entries are distinguished based on reference equality rather than object equality.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of items to be stored in the histogram
      Returns:
      a new Histogram instance that uses reference equality for its items

    • createHashBased

      public static <T> Histogram<T> createHashBased()
      Creates a new instance of Histogram backed by a HashMap as the underlying storage for counting occurrences of items.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of items to be counted in the histogram
      Returns:
      a Histogram instance utilizing a HashMap<T, Counter> for storage

    • add

      public void add(T item)
      Adds an item to the histogram, incrementing its associated count. If the item does not already exist in the histogram, it is added with an initial count of 1.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to be added to the histogram

    • getMax

      public Optional<T> getMax()
      Returns an optional containing the most frequently occurring item in the histogram, based on the highest count. If the histogram is empty, an empty optional is returned.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the item with the highest count, or an empty optional if the histogram has no items

    • getMaxEntry

      public Optional<Map.Entry<T,Counter>> getMaxEntry()
      Retrieves the entry with the maximum value in the histogram. The entry returned represents the item with the highest count and its associated count. If the histogram is empty, an empty Optional is returned.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the Map.Entry with the maximum value, or an empty Optional if the histogram is empty

    • getCount

      public long getCount(T item)
      Retrieves the count of occurrences for a specific item in the histogram. If the item is not found, the count defaults to zero.
      Parameters:
      item - the item whose count is to be retrieved
      Returns:
      the count of occurrences of the given item; returns zero if the item is not present

    • getKeys

      public Collection<T> getKeys()
      Returns an unmodifiable view of the keys in the histogram. Modifications to the returned collection are not allowed.
      Returns:
      a collection of keys stored in the histogram

    • entries

      public Stream<Histogram.Entry<T>> entries()
      Returns a stream of entries representing the items stored in the histogram along with their respective counts. Each entry includes the item (key) and its associated count.

      The stream is not ordered.

      Returns:
      a stream of Entry objects, where each entry contains a key and its associated count
